rules: Rule1: If the ecological survey is completed, then either the natural habitat is restored or the ecosystem is healthy.
Rule2: Either the ecological survey is completed or the conservation report is submitted.
Rule3: If the conservation report is submitted, then either the natural habitat is restored or the ecosystem is healthy.
Rule4: If the project manager is authorized, then the allocation of the emergency fund results in the project timeline not being delayed.
Rule5: If the field workshop is conducted, then either the natural habitat is restored or the ecosystem is healthy.
Rule6: Either the field workshop is conducted or the research paper is published.
Rule7: If the project timeline is accelerated, then the project timeline is not delayed.
Rule8: If the conference presentation is invited, then the scientific breakthrough is recognized.
Rule9: If the research prize is awarded, then the allocation of the emergency fund leads to the project timeline being accelerated.
Rule10: If the keynote speech is prepared, then the conference presentation is invited.
Rule11: Either the keynote speech is prepared or the supporting data is assembled.
Rule12: If the supporting data is assembled, then the research prize is awarded.
Rule13: Either the soil sample is ready or the ecosystem is healthy.
Rule14: Either the soil sample is analyzed or the soil sample is not ready.
Rule15: Either the rare species is planted or the soil sample is not analyzed.
Rule16: If the plant specimen is identified, then the ecosystem is healthy.
Rule17: If the plant specimen is photographed, then the plant specimen is identified.
Rule18: Either the plant specimen is photographed or the plant specimen is documented.
Rule19: If the plant specimen is documented, then the plant specimen is identified.
Rule20: If it is not the case that either the public trail is accessible or that the ecosystem not being healthy leads to the funding grant not being approved, then the complaint is escalated.

Rule21: If the failure of the research paper publication to lead to either the natural habitat being restored or the ecosystem being healthy does not result in legal action being initiated, then the dispute is resolved.

Rule22: If the failure of the research paper publication to lead to either the natural habitat being restored or the ecosystem being healthy does not result in legal action being initiated, then the dispute is not resolved.
Rule23: If the ecosystem is not healthy, then the funding grant is approved.
Rule24: If the ecosystem is not healthy, then the project timeline is delayed.
Rule25: If the ecosystem is not healthy, then the emergency fund is allocated.
facts: Fact1: The project manager is authorized.
Fact2: The natural habitat is not restored.
Fact3: Legal action is not initiated.
Fact4: The public trail is not accessible.
Fact5: The scientific breakthrough is not recognized.
Fact6: The complaint is not escalated.
Fact7: The rare species is not planted.
